snippet: Borrowing on credit cards fell by $2 billion, after a $3 billion decline in January.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports that consumers increased borrowing by $8.7 billion in February, the sixth consecutive monthly increase; total consumer borrowing rose to a seasonally adjusted $2.25 trillion.
lead_paragraph: Borrowing on credit cards fell by $2 billion, after a $3 billion decline in January.

headline.seo: Consumers Sought More Car Loans in February
headline.main: Credit Card Borrowing Falls; Car Lending Is on the Rise
headline.print_headline: Credit Card Borrowing Falls; Car Lending Is on the Rise
